PERSONA:
meet carlos hernandez, a 42-year-old hispanic man of mexican origin who has been living in the united states for over 25 years. born in mexico city, mexico, carlos moved to the united states with his family at the age of 17. he has been a citizen of the united states for over 20 years and identifies as white and of hispanic ethnicity. carlos practices roman catholicism but rarely attends church services.

carlos currently lives in a small apartment in a densely populated, urban neighborhood in los angeles, california, within the metropolitan area. he has been separated from his wife, ana, for about two years, but they share joint custody of their 9-year-old son, alejandro. carlos's marital separation has been a significant adjustment, and he continues to navigate co-parenting responsibilities while rebuilding his life.

carlos pursued higher education but did not complete his degree, having attended east los angeles college part-time while working full-time. he has an associate's degree in business administration from a local community college. despite his incomplete degree, carlos possesses excellent customer service skills and is fluent in english and spanish.

as a customer service representative at a small call center in downtown los angeles, carlos earns approximately $28,000 per year. he is a registered voter and identifies as a democrat, leaning toward moderate and conservative views. he values fairness, social justice, and education. however, his struggling economic situation makes him concerned about issues like affordable healthcare, housing costs, and quality education for his son.

in his free time, carlos enjoys watching soccer, exploring his mexican heritage through music, and trying out new foods. technology plays a significant role in his life; he spends a lot of time on social media and uses his smartphone to stay connected with family and friends. given his busy schedule and struggle to make ends meet, volunteering has not been feasible for carlos, but he remains committed to his community and hopes to find ways to get more involved in the future.

despite the challenges in his life, carlos maintains a positive outlook, drawing strength from his close-knit family, his faith, and the vibrant mexican-american community in los angeles.
